description:
The State of Qatar, sharing a border with Saudi Arabia to its south, occupies a small piece of the Arabian Peninsula that extends into the Persian Gulf. Once a protectorate of Britain, Qatar gained its independence in 1971, establishing a monarchy that is currently led by Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, who assumed power in 2013. 
At just 4,427 square miles, Qatar is small in stature but remains one of the world’s wealthiest countries on a per capita basis. Qatar’s wealth is largely derived from the production of oil and natural gas. The Qatari government has embarked on an ambitious industrialization plan in an effort to diversify the economy, and has further sought economic sustainability through its sizable sovereign wealth fund.
Qatar will become the first Arab country to host the FIFA World Cup in 2022. This has heightened international focus on widespread human rights abuses, particularly the exploitation of migrant laborers who compose some 86 percent of Qatar’s population.
Learn more about Qatar. Scroll below to view our archive of articles and chronology of latest news.
title: Qatar
maintext:
FIFA Seeks Last-Minute Change to World Cup Schedule
In a letter sent only months before the tournament, organizers have requested that the World Cup start one day earlier and allow Qatar, the host nation, to feature in its first match.
